required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of Digital Three-Dimensional Root Position Prediction Via Digitized Models
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Digital Three-Dimensional Root Position Prediction Via Digitized Models

brief_summary.textblock: Measuring the accuracy of a new technique by which root positions can be predicted at the pre-finishing stage of the comprehensive orthoodntic treatment

detailed_description.textblock:
A CBCT is taken Pre-Treatment
Segmentation of teeth is done from the CBCT exported as STL files and kept aside.
Routine comprehensive orthodontic treatment is done till pre-finishing stage.
Impression for teeth is taken at this timepoint.
A cast is poured and laser scanned.
Now the investigators have segmented teeth and a cast with new crown positions
The investigators will superimpose the teeth on the crowns of the digital cast to obtain the " Predicted Root Position" (PRP)
To check accuracy of this Prediction a CBCT is taken and compared to the prediction to check its accuracy.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of Root Position Prediction as assessed by Color Map Heat Analysis
primary_outcome.description: Using Color Map Heat Analysis in millimetres

study_pop.textblock: Patients having only permenant teeth and no decidous ones, requiring orthodontic treatment not involving extraction of teeth in their treatment plan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients requiring orthodontic treatment
- Adult set of permanent dentition
- Non-extraction cases
Exclusion Criteria:
- Syndromic patients
